title: Chinese Bazaar Held At Flushing Town Hall
author: NY
description: A Chinese tradition is now part of the Lunar New Year celebrations in Flushing.
cleaned_text: A Chinese tradition is now part of the Lunar New Year celebrations in Flushing. Flushing Town Hall held it's second annual Chinese New Year Temple Bazaar Saturday. The event featured musical performances and an origami, and calligraphy workshop. Organizers modeled the event after traditional Temple Bazaars held in China during Lunar New Year celebrations. "People who are familiar with the concept of a Chinese temple bazaar reminds them of home. I think a lot of people want to introduce their children either to their own cultures," said Executive Director Ellen Kodadek. "Everybody in the community get together and then have all kinds of really, not just fun, but to wish everyone a new year, good health," said Flushing resident Agatha Lin. Flushing Town Hall will be holding events to celebrate Lunar New Year throughout the month.
